content.text:
Here are the complete search results organized by topic for the Regen ecosystem daily digest dated 2026-02-08.

---

## 1. Regen Network -- Recent News 2026

**Biocultural Jaguar Credits Launch:**
The Sharamentsa Achuar community, in partnership with Fundacion Pachamama and Regen Network, launched "Biocultural Jaguar Credits" to protect 10,000 hectares of jaguar habitat in Ecuador. The initiative uses blockchain technology and advanced monitoring, with pre-financing already underway for this Indigenous-led conservation project.

**Regen Data Stream Tool:**
Regen Data Stream is now integrated into the Regen App, allowing users to post real-time project updates, anchor data to the blockchain for verification, and manage data privacy settings. It supports environmental projects, scientific research, and sustainability efforts.

**Platform Metrics:**
The Regen Network blockchain community consists of 75 validators, 20,000+ wallet holders, and 42 major projects building on Regen Ledger. Partners include Moss.Earth, Open Earth Foundation, Earthbanc, ERA Brazil, Shamba Protocol, and Terra Genesis International.

**Market Performance:**
REGEN token is down -16.30% over the last 7 days, underperforming the global cryptocurrency market which is down -2.70%.

Sources:
- [Regen Network](https://www.regen.network/)
- [Regen Registry](https://www.registry.regen.network/)
- [Regen Price on CoinGecko](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/regen)
- [Regen Network on LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/regen-network/)

---

## 2. Ecological Credits -- Carbon & Biodiversity 2026

**Carbon Credit Market Surging:**
The carbon credit market is valued at approximately $2.52 billion in 2025, with projections to expand to $3.04 billion in 2026 and reach $16.38 billion by 2035 (CAGR of 20.59%). A separate report from Astute Analytica projects the market growing by 18% to reach $4,938.7 billion by 2035. Growth is driven by corporate demand, net-zero targets, and tightening regulations.

**Biodiversity Co-Benefits Premium:**
The market is increasingly rewarding projects that demonstrate tangible positive impacts on biodiversity. Carbon credits carrying biodiversity certifications (such as Climate, Community & Biodiversity Standards) command an average price premium of over $2.50 per credit.

**Biodiversity Credit Alliance Strategic Plan:**
The Biodiversity Credit Alliance released its 2025-2026 Strategic Plan, charting a path to build a transparent, trustworthy, and high-integrity global biodiversity credit market. The plan focuses on science-based principles, market governance, and ensuring meaningful participation by Indigenous Peoples and local communities. An estimated $598-824 billion funding gap exists to reach Global Biodiversity Framework targets.

**EU Nature Credits:**
The EU market for nature credits will align with at least four marine protection policies, helping bridge the funding gap left by carbon markets alone.

Sources:
- [Carbon Credit Business Report 2026 -- GlobeNewsWire](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2026/02/02/3230006/0/en/Carbon-Credit-Business-Report-2026-Market-to-Grow-by-18-to-Reach-4-938-7-Bn-Investment-Opportunities-by-2035-Astute-Analytica.html)
- [Carbon Credit Prices and Forecasts 2026 -- Regreener](https://www.regreener.earth/blog/carbon-credit-prices-today-trends-and-forecasts-for-2026)
- [Biodiversity Credit Alliance](https://www.biodiversitycreditalliance.org/)
- [Nature & Biodiversity Pulse -- Carbon Pulse](https://carbon-pulse.com/nbp/)
- [Biodiversity and Carbon Co-Benefits ROI -- Sylvera](https://www.sylvera.com/blog/biodiversity-premiums-co-benefits)
- [Best EU Carbon Credit Projects of 2026 -- Regreener](https://www.regreener.earth/blog/the-5-best-eu-carbon-credit-projects-of-2026)

---

## 3. Regenerative Agriculture -- February 2026

**USDA $700 Million Regenerative Pilot Program:**
On December 10, 2025, USDA Secretary Brooke Rollins announced a $700 million pilot program for regenerative agriculture: $400 million through the Environmental Quality Incentives Program (EQIP) and $300 million through the Conservation Stewardship Program (CSP). The program delivers a streamlined, outcome-based conservation model empowering producers to plan and implement whole-farm regenerative practices through a single application. It is designed for both beginning and advanced producers.

**Food Industry Scaling Regenerative Supply Chains:**
Three flour brands are redefining how regenerative agriculture scales (as of February 5, 2026). King Arthur Baking Co. has committed to sourcing 100% of its flour from regeneratively grown wheat by 2030. Cairnspring Mills and Simple Mills are also broadening adoption of regenerative sourcing.

**Greenwashing Concerns:**
Public health and environmental advocates fear that the loosely defined "regenerative agriculture" label in the USDA program will undermine existing organic transition efforts and contribute to greenwashing. Beyond Pesticides and others argue the program diverts resources from organic transition.

**Economic Case Strengthening:**
The Danforth Center sees a big future in regenerative agriculture that actually returns profits, signaling that the economic case for regen ag is becoming clearer.

Sources:
- [USDA Launches Regenerative Pilot Program](https://www.usda.gov/about-usda/news/press-releases/2025/12/10/usda-launches-new-regenerative-pilot-program-lower-farmer-production-costs-and-advance-maha-agenda)
- [USDA $700 Million for Regenerative Agriculture -- NACo](https://www.naco.org/news/us-department-agriculture-unveils-700-million-regenerative-agriculture)
- [3 Flour Brands Scaling Regenerative Agriculture -- FoodNavigator-USA](https://www.foodnavigator-usa.com/Article/2026/02/05/how-food-brands-are-scaling-regenerative-agriculture/)
- [Greenwashing Concerns -- Beyond Pesticides](https://beyondpesticides.org/dailynewsblog/2026/01/usdas-new-regenerative-agriculture-program-called-greenwashing-diverts-resources-needed-for-organic-transition/)
- [Danforth Center on Regen Ag Economics -- St. Louis Magazine](https://www.stlmag.com/business/regenerative-agricultures-economic-future/)
- [AgNet News Hour: Regenerative Ag & Dairy Insights 2026](https://agnetwest.com/agnet-news-hour-regenerative-ag-dairy-insights-2026/)

---

## 4. Climate Finance & ReFi 2026

**Global Climate Finance Exceeds $2 Trillion:**
Global climate finance hit an all-time high of $1.9 trillion in 2023, with early data indicating it exceeded $2 trillion for the first time in 2024. At COP30, countries solidified the Baku to Belem (B2B) Roadmap aiming for $1.3 trillion/year in international finance to developing countries by 2035.

**UK Climate Finance U-Turn Risk:**
As of February 7, 2026, there are concerns that the UK may be about to reverse its climate financing commitments to poorer countries, despite the global pledge to triple climate financing.

**UNEP State of Finance for Nature 2026:**
UNEP has published its State of Finance for Nature 2026 report, providing a comprehensive overview of nature-related financial flows.

**2026 Sustainable Finance Opportunities (WRI):**
The World Resources Institute identified six opportunities for sustainable finance in 2026, noting that core banking, investor, and insurance commitments on climate and nature finance remain relatively robust despite well-publicized attacks and the shuttering of net-zero alliances for banking and insurance.

**ReFi Movement Analysis:**
A Frontiers in Blockchain paper examined "The ReFi movement in Web3: implications for the Global Commons," while a companion paper offered a critical evaluation of the regenerative claims of Web3's ReFi movement. Key trends for 2026 include ReFi + AI for ecological data monitoring, ReFi + Real-World Assets (RWAs), ReFi + gamification for sustainable behaviors, and cross-chain ReFi. However, critics note that many ReFi initiatives may merely apply financial engineering and linear models to environmental challenges under a regenerative label.

Sources:
- [6 Opportunities for Sustainable Finance in 2026 -- WRI](https://www.wri.org/technical-perspectives/6-opportunities-sustainable-finance-2026)
- [UK Climate Finance Concerns -- Euronews](https://www.euronews.com/green/2026/02/07/the-world-has-pledged-to-triple-climate-financing-for-poorer-countries-is-the-uk-about-to-)
- [State of Finance for Nature 2026 -- UNEP](https://www.unep.org/resources/state-finance-nature-2026)
- [Global Landscape of Climate Finance 2025 -- CPI](https://www.climatepolicyinitiative.org/publication/global-landscape-of-climate-finance-2025/)
- [12 Investors on Climate Tech in 2026 -- TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2025/12/30/12-investors-dish-on-what-2026-will-bring-for-climate-tech/)
- [The ReFi Movement in Web3 -- Frontiers in Blockchain](https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/blockchain/articles/10.3389/fbloc.2025.1564073/full)
- [Critical Evaluation of ReFi Claims -- Frontiers in Blockchain](https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/blockchain/articles/10.3389/fbloc.2025.1564083/full)
- [Climate and Nature Finance Conference, Spring 2026 -- NBER](https://www.nber.org/conferences/climate-and-nature-finance-spring-2026)

---

## 5. Cosmos Ecosystem & IBC -- February 2026

**IBC Eureka (IBC v2) Live:**
IBC Eureka is the main implementation of IBC v2, offering seamless bridging and interoperability to hundreds of chains through one IBC connection to the Cosmos Hub. The ecosystem now provides access to 120+ chains from Cosmos to Ethereum and beyond, with faster-than-finality transfers, low fees, and native asset issuance.

**2026 Roadmap -- Multi-Chain Expansion:**
Ethereum was added to the IBC network in 2025. In 2026, work is expected to add dozens more networks. Cosmos Labs is close to productionizing IBC v2 light clients for Solana and a general solution for EVM/L2 chains. The Q2 roadmap targets IBC GMP, IFT, Solana and L2/EVM support. Q4 targets SDK releases aiming for 5,000 TPS and 500ms blocktimes sustained in production.

**Sei Network Departing Cosmos:**
Sei Network has scheduled the disabling of inbound IBC transfers for February 2026 as part of its transition to becoming an EVM-only chain by mid-2026, fully abandoning the Cosmos SDK.

Sources:
- [The Cosmos Stack Roadmap for 2026 -- Cosmos Labs](https://www.cosmoslabs.io/blog/the-cosmos-stack-roadmap-2026)
- [IBC Eureka Connects Ethereum to Cosmos -- The Block](https://www.theblock.co/post/350316/interchain-labs-launches-ibc-eureka-to-connect-ethereum-to-the-cosmos-ecosystem)
- [Sei Network Abandons Cosmos for EVM](https://bitcoinethereumnews.com/finance/sei-network-sets-mid-2026-target-for-fully-abandon-cosmos-for-evm-only-chain/)
- [IBC Ecosystem -- Cosmos](https://cosmos.network/ibc)
- [Cosmos IBC Eureka Announcement on X](https://x.com/cosmos/status/1910289530067747019)

---

## 6. MRV & Ecological Monitoring 2026

**CO2 Monitoring Verification System Going Operational:**
The CO2 Monitoring, Verification and Support system (CO2MVS) is expected to become operational in 2026, aligned with the launch of a new Copernicus Sentinel satellite mission. This prototype system will estimate CO2 and CH4 emissions from human activities on global, regional, and local scales.

**Soil Organic Carbon Monitoring (MRV4SOC):**
The MRV4SOC project focuses on creating a monitoring system for soil organic carbon, tracking long-term SOC accumulation changes in nine ecosystem types representing distinct land use types within the EU.

**Modular MRV Frameworks for Carbon:**
Researchers published a framework for a modular, scalable MRV system covering croplands, grasslands, and forestlands, moving toward standardized monitoring across multiple ecosystem types.

**ICOS Science Conference 2026:**
The ICOS Science Conference 2026 will take place September 15-17 in Lund, Sweden, with a call for abstracts on "Advancing MRV through Research Infrastructures."

Sources:
- [Modular MRV Framework for Soil Carbon -- Taylor & Francis](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/17583004.2024.2410812)
- [MRV 101: State of MRV in Nature Tech -- Nature Tech Collective](https://www.naturetechcollective.org/stories/mrv-101-the-state-of-measurement-reporting-and-verification-in-nature-tech)
- [Advancing MRV at ICOS Science Conference 2026 -- eLTER RI](https://elter-ri.eu/news/call-abstracts-advancing-mrv-through-research-infrastructures-icos-science-conference-2026)
- [EU MRV for Emissions Trading -- European Commission](https://climate.ec.europa.eu/eu-action/carbon-markets/eu-emissions-trading-system-eu-ets/monitoring-reporting-and-verification_en)

---

## 7. Community Currencies & Mutual Credit 2026

**China's Digital Yuan Pays Interest (January 1, 2026):**
China's digital yuan entered a new era on January 1, 2026, as wallet balances began accruing interest at demand deposit rates. This breaks the prevailing global consensus that central bank digital currencies should remain non-interest-bearing, and could reshape how digital currencies are designed worldwide.

**BRICS Payment System Pilot:**
Russian Foreign Minister Lavrov said a BRICS payment system pilot could appear "before the end of 2026." The platform will be blockchain-based and decentralized, linking existing national systems and integrating CBDCs from member states including the digital yuan and digital ruble. Target operational status is 2030.

**Brazil's Drex Rollback:**
Brazil's Drex digital currency project was rolled back and will now launch in 2026 in an initial version without blockchain, focused on infrastructure for reconciling credit liens.

**EU Regulating Decentralized Finance:**
Europe plans to regulate decentralized finance in 2026 as lawmakers struggle to define decentralization under MiCA (Markets in Crypto-Assets regulation).

**Community Currency Conceptual Developments:**
Research continues on the circulation dynamics of digital community currencies, with a 2023 Nature paper analyzing transaction patterns. The broader movement continues connecting local exchange trading systems, time banks, community exchange networks, and B2B barter exchanges, though no major new community currency launches were found for early 2026.

Sources:
- [China Digital Yuan Interest-Bearing Features -- CGTN](https://news.cgtn.com/news/2026-01-05/VHJhbnNjcmlwdDg4MzQ4/index.html)
- [China Breaks CBDC Orthodoxy -- Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/china-breaks-cbdc-orthodoxy-digital-050942170.html)
- [Digital Currencies Tracker -- Atlantic Council](https://www.atlanticcouncil.org/issue/digital-currencies/)
- [Community Currency to Crypto City Tokens -- Belfer Center](https://www.belfercenter.org/publication/community-currency-crypto-city-tokens-potentials-shortfalls-and-future-outlooks-new-old)
- [Circulation of a Digital Community Currency -- Nature](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-023-33184-1)

---

## 8. Bioregionalism & Watershed Governance 2026

**Continental Bioregional Congress Planned for 2026:**
For the first time in more than 15 years, bioregionalists from across North America are coming together to plan a Continental Bioregional Congress. The Cascadia Department of Bioregion is calling for site location suggestions (deadline April 8). The gathering will bring organizers, artists, land stewards, and community leaders from the U.S., Canada, and Mexico to reconnect, build trust, and coordinate grounded responses rooted in care for watersheds, ecosystems, and communities.

**Bioregionalism, Commoning, and Relationalized Finance (January 8, 2026):**
A new essay on Resilience.org explores "relationalized finance" -- finance structurally designed to prioritize the ecological imperatives of a bioregional landscape, conjoining the terms of finance with a bioregion's watersheds, forests, arable land, human provisioning systems, communities of practice, and culture.

**Bioregional Governance Training Guide for Asia-Pacific:**
ECOLISE published a Bioregional Governance Training Guide for climate-resilient ecosystems in Asia and the Pacific, providing frameworks for applying bioregional governance principles in diverse contexts.

**NOEMA Feature on Bioregionalism's Tech-Driven Revival:**
NOEMA magazine published "Inside Bioregionalism's Tech-Driven Revival," examining how technology is being used to rebuild society around ecosystems rather than political boundaries.

**Bioregional Earth Movement:**
The Bioregional Earth organization continues documenting the emergence of the bioregional movement, mapping how Mother Earth is being remapped as bioregions rather than nation-states.

Sources:
- [Continental Bioregional Congress 2026 -- Cascadia Department of Bioregion](https://cascadiabioregion.org/department-of-bioregion/a-continental-bioregional-congress-is-in-the-works-for-2026-suggest-a-site-location-by-april-8th)
- [Bioregionalism, Commoning, and Relationalized Finance -- Resilience.org](https://www.resilience.org/stories/2026-01-08/bioregionalism-commoning-and-relationalized-finance/)
- [Human Watershed: Bioregional Democracy -- Kosmos Journal](https://www.kosmosjournal.org/article/human-watershed-the-emerging-politics-of-bioregional-democracy/)
- [Inside Bioregionalism's Tech-Driven Revival -- NOEMA](https://www.noemamag.com/inside-the-push-to-rebuild-society-around-ecosystems/)
- [Bioregional Governance Training Guide -- ECOLISE](https://ecolise.eu/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/Bioregional-Governance-Training-Guide.pdf)
- [The Bioregional Movement -- Bioregional Earth](https://www.bioregionalearth.org/blog/bioregional-movement)

---

## Cross-Cutting Themes for the Digest

Several threads connect across these topics that would be worth highlighting in a daily digest:

1. **Indigenous-led conservation meets blockchain**: The Biocultural Jaguar Credits on Regen Network and the Biodiversity Credit Alliance's focus on Indigenous participation reflect a growing convergence of Indigenous stewardship and digital infrastructure.

2. **Institutional money flowing into regenerative systems**: The USDA's $700M regenerative pilot, the carbon credit market projected to reach $3B+ in 2026, and climate finance exceeding $2 trillion all signal that regenerative approaches are entering mainstream financial flows -- with accompanying greenwashing tensions.

3. **IBC expansion creates opportunities for ecological assets**: With IBC v2 connecting 120+ chains and adding Solana/EVM support in 2026, the infrastructure for cross-chain ecological credit trading is maturing, even as some chains (Sei) depart the Cosmos ecosystem.

4. **MRV infrastructure maturing alongside credit markets**: The CO2MVS satellite system going operational in 2026 and modular soil carbon MRV frameworks align with Regen Network's core thesis that credible ecological credits require robust monitoring infrastructure.

5. **Bioregionalism gaining institutional momentum**: The first Continental Bioregional Congress in 15+ years and new frameworks for "relationalized finance" suggest the bioregional governance model is moving from theory toward practice.

6. **Digital currency experiments diversifying**: China's interest-bearing digital yuan, the BRICS payment pilot, and EU DeFi regulation show that the monetary landscape is fragmenting in ways that create both opportunities and regulatory challenges for community-scale economic experiments.

file.content:
# Regen Ledger Plugin

Access Regen Network blockchain data through the Regen Ledger MCP server.

## Features

- Bank module queries (balances, supply, metadata)
- Distribution module (rewards, validators)
- Governance (proposals, votes, deposits)
- Ecocredits (classes, projects, batches)
- Baskets and marketplace tools
- Analytics and portfolio analysis

## Prerequisites

- uv (`curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh`)

## Installation

```bash
/plugin install ledger@regen-ai
# Restart Claude Code
/mcp
```

No setup required - the MCP server runs directly from PyPI via `uvx`.

## Package

[pypi.org/project/regen-python-mcp](https://pypi.org/project/regen-python-mcp/)

## Source

[github.com/gaiaaiagent/regen-python-mcp](https://github.com/gaiaaiagent/regen-python-mcp)
